---
title: "node.js"
---

## High-level description
This code is a simple re-export of the `deprecate` function from Node.js's core `util` module. It allows other modules to use the `deprecate` functionality by importing it from this file, which acts as a wrapper or proxy for the core Node.js utility.

## Symbols

### `module.exports`
#### Description
This symbol assigns the `deprecate` function from Node.js's `util` module to `module.exports`, making it available for other modules to import and use.

#### Inputs
N/A

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| deprecate | Function | The `deprecate` function from Node.js's `util` module |

## Dependencies
| Dependency | Purpose |
|:-----------|:--------|
| util | To access the `deprecate` function from Node.js's core utilities |

## References
This code references the `util` module from Node.js core libraries, specifically its `deprecate` function.

## Notes
1. This file is part of the `util-deprecate` package, which provides a cross-platform way to mark functions as deprecated.
2. For Node.js environments, it simply re-exports the built-in `util.deprecate` function, while in other environments (like browsers), it might provide a custom implementation.
3. The `deprecate` function is commonly used to mark functions or methods as deprecated, allowing developers to provide warnings when these deprecated elements are used, while still maintaining backwards compatibility.
